fmdefinition: Recrystallized detrital clay or protomatrix, recognized by relict detrital textures and inhomogeneity, in contrast to the homogeneity of clay cements.
fmreferences: Dickinson W R. Interpreting detrital modes of graywacke and arkose[J]. Journal of Sedimentary Research, 1970, 40(2): 695-707.

fmdefinition: Authigenic interstitial materials grown in originally open interstices but lacking the homogeneity of clay cements.
fmreferences: Dickinson W R. Interpreting detrital modes of graywacke and arkose. Journal of Sedimentary Research, 1970, 40(2): 695-707.

fmdefinition: Discontinuous matrix-like material formed by squeezing and flowing of weak detrital grains, such as shale or phyllite fragments, into adjacent pore spaces.
fmreferences: Dickinson W R. Interpreting detrital modes of graywacke and arkose. Journal of Sedimentary Research, 1970, 40(2): 695-707.

fmdefinition: Unrecrystallized, detrital clay in weakly consolidated rocks.
fmreferences: Dickinson W R. Interpreting detrital modes of graywacke and arkose[J]. Journal of Sedimentary Research, 1970, 40(2): 695-707.
